hypothesis_content.title: Altcoin Momentum Surge Post-BTC Consolidation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a tight range (+/- 1%) for 36 hours during a NEUTRAL/BULL regime, a breakout above the range high triggers outsized momentum in mid-cap altcoins (rank 20-100 by market cap) relative to BTC over the next 12 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: News mentions 'explosive altcoin momentum'. BTC consolidation suggests capital is sidelined; a breakout signals renewed risk-on appetite, with capital often rotating aggressively into higher-beta altcoins to catch up. Measuring via dominance filters out general market moves.
entry_conditions: BTC breaks above the 36-hour range high on a 1-hour closing basis
Simultaneously, the total market cap of altcoins (excluding BTC & ETH) is above its 20-hour SMA

exit_conditions.take_profit: Altcoin market cap dominance (ex-BTC/ETH) increases by 0.15%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC falls back below the 36-hour range midpoint

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The average change in altcoin dominance following the setup is <= 0.05%, or the success rate (TP hit before SL/time) is < 50%.
